Gray Davis huddled two hours Democratic legislative leaders Monday, keeping distance several weeks, agreement emerged give small generators choice: Take higher price exchange short-term commitments buy power, accept lower price exchange multiyear commitment buy sources attended meeting said. governor Legislature would quickly devise way ensure producers start getting paid, least power continue produce. long utilities collecting money customers, Davis later told labor group, "they're going make payments." alternative producers' rates pegged price natural gas, skyrocketed recent months. prices critical factor Davis' overall plan buying power without imposing additional consumer rate hikes. growing number unpaid producers dropped offline, state officials forced purchase replacement supplies pricey spot market. worst-case scenario materialized Monday, lack electricity supplies forced state officials order blackouts. CEC symposium take place San Diego 29-30 November, bring together leading experts industry, academia, NGOs governments Canada, Mexico United States consider impact evolving continental electricity market human health environment. "Our goal [with working symposium] highlight key environmental issues must addressed electricity markets North America become integrated," said Janine Ferretti, executive director CEC. "We want stimulate discussion around important policy questions countries cooperate approach energy environment." CEC, international organization created environmental side agreement NAFTA known North American Agreement Environmental Cooperation, established address regional environmental concerns, help prevent potential trade environmental conflicts, promote effective enforcement environmental law. CEC Secretariat believes greater North American cooperation environmental policies regarding continental electricity market necessary to: * protect air quality mitigate climate change, * minimize possibility environment-based trade disputes, * ensure dependable supply reasonably priced electricity across North America * avoid creation pollution havens, * ensure local national environmental measures remain effective. Changing Market working paper profiles rapid changing North American electricity market. example, 2001, US projected export 13.1 thousand (GWh) electricity Canada Mexico. 2007, number projected grow 16.9 thousand GWh electricity. "Over past decades, North American electricity market developed complex array cross-border transactions relationships," said Phil Sharp, former US congressman chairman Electricity Advisory Board. "We need achieve new level cooperation environmental approaches well." Environmental Profile Electricity Sector electricity sector largest source nationally reported toxins United States Canada large source Mexico. US, electricity sector emits approximately 25 percent NOx emissions, roughly 35 percent CO2 emissions, 25 percent mercury emissions almost 70 percent SO2 emissions. emissions large impact watersheds migratory species corridors often shared three North American countries. "We want discuss possible outcomes greater efforts coordinate federal, state provincial environmental laws policies relate electricity sector," said Ferretti. "How develop compatible environmental approaches help make domestic environmental policies effective?" Effects Integrated Electricity Market One key issue raised paper effect market integration competitiveness particular fuels coal, natural gas renewables. Fuel choice largely determines environmental impacts specific facility, along pollution control technologies, performance standards regulations. paper highlights impacts highly competitive market well. example, concerns called "pollution havens" arise significant differences environmental laws enforcement practices induce power companies locate operations jurisdictions lower standards. "The CEC Secretariat exploring additional environmental policies work restructured market policies adapted ensure enhance competitiveness benefit entire region," said Sharp. trade rules policy measures directly influence variables drive successfully integrated North American electricity market, working paper also addresses fuel choice, technology, pollution control strategies subsidies. CEC use information gathered discussion period develop final report submitted Council early 2002. information view live video webcast symposium, please go to: http://www.cec.org/electricity. may download working paper supporting documents from: http://www.cec.org/programs_projects/other_initiatives/electricity/docs.cfm?varlan=english. JASON LEOPOLD DOW JONES NEWSWIRES LOS ANGELES (Dow Jones)--The California Independent System Operator expected file petition federal regulators Friday seeking authority force generators bid 70% supply forward market effort reduce wholesale power costs state, according source familiar issue. official state's Electricity Oversight Board confirmed details filing. filing calls FERC set "just reasonable" rate large fraction suppliers' capacity, remaining supply able earn market-based rates, according source. addition, major out-of-state generators would enter forward contracts FERC mandated rates "a significant portion expected ISO Chairman Chief Executive Terry Winter hold news conference Friday morning focus possible solutions lower wholesale energy costs. expected announce bidding forward market stabilize high wholesale power costs. state's Public Utilities Commission expected make similar filing federal regulators near future, sources said. addition, forcing generators bid forward market measure would reduce market power state would protect majority utilities served generators cost impact market power, ISO said prior meetings. Market power term used economists describe generators influence power prices. According ISO report, market power occurred past summer tight power supply concentration generation ownership "allowed suppliers pivotal relatively high demand periods." 50% 60% power purchased past summer done spot market, unusually high percentage, according ISO. order mitigate market power, filing calls utilities enter two-year forward contracts generators shield daily market price fluctuations. Regulatory constraints associated forward contracting "key source high (power) costs summer 2000," according ISO report. ISO action taken without approval grid operator's board governors. Usually, majority board required approve action. EOB Official Surprised ISO Action announcement ISO's expected filing came surprise Gary Heath, executive director state's Electricity Oversight Board. Heath told Dow Jones Newswires aware filing news "We're find what's behind this," Heath told Dow Jones Newswires. "We're sure could without board approval. came surprise." Sources said agency holding news conference attempt eclipse imminent structural changes ISO expected proposed Federal Energy Regulatory Commission next month. FERC launched investigation California's troubled power market past summer based allegations market workably competitive participants manipulate market. Energy officials blamed ISO summer's power woes. -By Jason Leopold; Dow Jones Newswires; 323-658-3874; mailto:jason.leopold@dowjones.com (END) Dow Jones Newswires 20-10-00 0307GMT Michael E. [IMAGE] IssueAlert March 21, 2001 Dissension FERC: Commission Divided Price Caps, Future Leadership McNamara Director, Electric Industry Analysis [News item Reuters, March 20] Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) said remained divided whether impose temporary cap wholesale prices western United States prevent summer blackouts price spikes. three FERC commissioners, regulate interstate electricity markets, testified House Representatives Energy Air subcommittee hearing California braced another day blackouts. Since start deregulation early 1990s, FERC's various positions competition unfold across country fairly consistent. Despite changing members, whole five-member (with two positions currently open) taken "hands-off" approach regulatory role, preferring instead allow free market forces drive competition energy industry. fact, Curt H,bert, appointed FERC chairman January President Bush, told interview tenure commissioner envisioned time FERC would step regulatory role altogether. However, significant structural philosophical changes within FERC surfaced since January, dovetailing departure former chairman James Hoecker. federal regulatory body energy FERC responsibility setting price caps regions across country. debate whether controversial step seems exposed inherent dissension within FERC time future leadership commission cast doubt. Representatives meeting March 20, H,bert, Republican, reiterated objections price caps. Chairman H,bert maintained opinion wholesale price caps done "long-term damage." January, H,bert me, "I seen evidence price caps positive impact creating balanced Although still generally opposed wholesale price caps federal regional level, willing consider one possibility among short-term resolutions ongoing market California. Reuters reported H,bert said hearings "such controls long-term solution would industry building power plants supply West." Rather, H,bert believes power generators need financial incentive build new power plants, California elsewhere. H,bert quoted subcommittee hearings saying, "Market prices increase supply reduce demand, thus correcting current imbalance. Capping prices regulation legislation exactly opposite effect." Despite H,bert's opposition wholesale price caps, fellow Commissioner William Massey, Democrat, asserted California western region state disrepair temporary "time out" price cap needed let market stabilize. commission must act forcefully decisively reassure market participants, policymakers consumers jurisdictional wholesale markets produce consumer benefits rates," Massey said. addition, Massey reportedly also said "such price cap could calculated generator-by-generator basis generator's variable cost, plus reasonable capacity adder, perhaps range $25 per megawatt hour." Massey reiterated severity crisis California, noting whereas wholesale power state cost $7 billion 1999 increased $27 billion 2000 could exceed $70 billion 2001. Rounding commission's divided opinion Commissioner Linda Key Breathitt, Democrat, said possible options analyzed debated. Breathitt specifically mention preference price controls. Chairman H,bert's stand price caps shared Energy Secretary Spencer Abraham seemingly entire Bush administration. fact, Abraham said price caps wholesale energy "discourage investment new generation time needed" drive power producers regions country (and away California). Energy Secretary reportedly issued even statement price caps Senate electricity crisis California. "The action administration implementation price caps," Abraham said. Another House Representatives Energy Air Quality subcommittee hearing scheduled later week. Subcommittee Chairman Joe Barton, Texas Republican, noted subcommittee work toward deciding whether legislation regarding wholesale price caps developed next weeks. first time clear schisms become visible within FERC major issues facing energy industry. commission also became divided regarding scope regulation regarding regional transmission (RTOs). FERC's December 1999 vote Alliance RTO illustrated dissension within commission divergent philosophies FERC commissioners hold regarding industry Then-Commissioner H,bert opinion Alliance RTO met FERC guidelines RTO formation, sole member pushed voluntary rather mandatory participation RTO. However, H,bert stood minority. three commissioners FERC time (Hoecker, Massey Breathitt) preferred wield tighter regulatory monitor transmission owners comply current transmission H,bert supports ownership RTOs utilities letting free market principles rule, commissioners FERC appeared support passive ownership RTOs utilities. Meanwhile, speculation continues President Bush soon appoint Pat Wood III, chairman Public Utility Commission Texas (PUCT), position FERC chairman. H,bert named February President Bush James Hoecker resigned shortly new Republican administration took office Jan. 20. time, president indicate appointment chair temporary. Wood appointed Governor Bush PUCT 1995 played primary role development state's restructuring plan. (Electric choice begins Texas June 1, 2001, start pilot program market opens fully competition Jan. 1, 2002). possible shift leadership FERC appears politically motivated. two "Republican" openings filled President Bush. noted, presently H,bert Republican among three members. Wood, reportedly close ally advisor former Texas governor, repeatedly named strong candidate one Republican openings FERC time. However, Washington Post Reuters reported Wood appointed FERC chairman, forcing H,bert step role commissioner. report Reuters indicated H,bert, friend Senate Majority Leader Trent Lott (R-Miss.), personally "fighting planned move." nomination would require Senate confirmation. Moreover, political drivers continue impact structure FERC, issue price caps remains unresolved. debate price caps also divided others involved, strictly along party lines. Generally speaking, Democrats believe federal government step prevent called "price gouging" part energy companies. Republicans believe government (including FERC Bush administration) maintain "hands-off" approach allow marketplace determine prices. Speaking non-partisan point view, economists question whether*and how*deregulation electricity markets occur all. instance, Alfred E. Kahn, Cornell University economist helped deregulate says electricity markets may lend full competition may value retaining vertical integration among utilities (allowing single regulated power company produce, transmit distribute electricity). movement toward re-regulation certainly throws additional wrinkle debate wholesale price caps. Yet, event, California remains catalyst decision-making issue. rolling blackouts threaten continue third day state, federal lawmakers may pressured issue definitive position wholesale price caps California, course would set precedent rest country. industry's top agency charge wholesale markets, FERC's ultimate position price caps carries tremendous influence. Despite apparent dissension within commission possible changes leadership, FERC presently challenged formulate solid policy wholesale transactions conducted, absolve jurisdiction area. archive list previous IssueAlerts available www.ConsultRCI.com Reach thousands utility analysts decision makers every day. company schedule sponsorship IssueAlert Nancy Spring e-mail calling (505)244-7613. EIA: Gas Takes Bigger Share Long-Term higher rate economic growth lead greater expansion natural gas use previously forecast next 20 years --- 34.7 Tcf/ year 2020, 31.5 Tcf 10% increase projected prices --- $2.81/Mcf $3.13, according Energy Information Administration's latest report. EIA's Annual Energy Outlook 2001 (AEO2001) released today projects U.S. economic growth average rate 3% year next 20 years, previous estimate 2.1% per year. economic growth overall U.S. energy demand 96 quadrillion Btu 127 quads 2020, 121 energy quads projected EIA one year ago (see Daily GPI, Nov. 10, 1999). increase projection natural gas demand 2020 slightly 3 Tcf (loosely equal 3 quads) responsible half change energy projections. EIA says 62% increase gas demand 21.4 Tcf 1999 34.7 Tcf 2020, spurred tripling gas use power generation. next 20 years 89% new power generation units fueled natural gas. Gas prices expected decline within two years current highs. "In longer term, technology improvements exploration production oil natural gas expected moderate price increases even demand fuels grows." EIA projects world oil prices reach $22.41/barrel (in 1999 dollars) 2020, slightly $22.04 last year's forecast. federal bean counters see 1.8% average annual increase power demand next 20 years, compared 1.3% predicted last year. Prices decline current 6.7 cents per kWh, much predicted last year due higher projected gas prices. Instead 5.8 cents per kWh 2020, EIA's AEO2001 sees electric rates holding 6.0 cents per kWh. Power provided nuclear generation jumped 34% forecast last year "due lower estimated costs extending life current nuclear plants higher projected natural gas prices, although total nuclear generation still declines existing plants retire." Coal still primary fuel power generation, share dwindle 51% 44% generating total. full report go site: http://www.eia.doe.gov/oiaf/aeo/earlyrelease/index.html *********** I'm sorry taken long get back you. truly chaotic around California situation, lawyers obviously preoccupied, Christian gotten back yet. finally went back Chris Mallory, determined language confirm fine long matches confirm language original deal - 459996. sale Constellation index + $1, we're trying clear positions California Power Exchange, buy back index + $3. make sense, rambling? long day. Commission took stab correcting California's problems utilizing several measures, one $150 price cap. Whereas applaud Commission's effort, find price caps send wrong signal suppliers load. found price caps misallocate resources, Staff report demonstrates, increases exports power parts grid caps exists. find price caps discourage demand-side participation, level proposed, discourage much needed peaking generation resources. also find price cap, especially level proposed, create unintended consequences. example, market bids exceed $150, sellers avoid bidding ISO PX. market solution simple bidding instead competitive exchange PX, APX, AlTrade? liquidity bids suddenly flip one market another arbitrary line single price auction operates, bilateral market prevails? huge hammer, huge movement tens millions dollars moving within space hour one trading vehicle another. WPTF price caps, continues believe price caps much damage, protect consumers. damages include prolonging high prices, reducing price discovery, reducing quantity long-term offers otherwise would afford consumers much-needed price protection. Average prices diminish caps, fact, know, August prices California much higher last June, even though buyer price cap imposed ISO Governing Board $250 instead $750. recognize political reality regulators like price spikes, caps quick solution. feel price caps must imposed, limit damage. believe Commissioner Hebert's price cap proposal starts $250, increments upward specific amounts specific times would least damaging. also believe formulaic price cap moves respect demand, fuel price would harmful. Market participants conduct business much uncertainty hanging balance. NGI's Daily Gas Price Index Breaking News : posted Oct 25, 11:12 Breathitt 'Uneasy' Approach Pipe Certification Although FERC California regulators made lot headway past months effort relieve imbalance in-state interstate pipeline capacity, Commissioner Linda Breathitt said Wednesday still somewhat unsettled FERC's tendency routinely approve interstate pipe projects without giving full weight impact existing shippers. "I remain uneasy the...policies Commission advanced favor certification interstate capacity despite [inadequacy] takeaway capacity particularly Commission rejected legitimate concerns shippers [Kern River's] system," said regular FERC meeting. Breathitt's remarks part concurring opinion two orders FERC denied rehearing certificate approval Kern River Gas Transmission's 2002 Expansion Project California Action Project [CP01-31, CP01-106-001]. Firm customers Kern River sought reconsideration certificate orders grounds expansions would result pro-rata capacity reductions existing shippers Wheeler Ridge would diminish firm delivery rights. Despite concerns, Breathitt noted "pleased past six months Commission come acknowledge actions certificating Kern River expansions could exacerbate problems delivering natural gas end-users Southern California." Even importantly, "the Commission recognized potential degradation shippers' firm rights resulting certification additional interstate capacity appropriate factor public benefits analysis use determine whether project public convenience necessity," said. Moreover, "I relieved certain events occurring California mitigate congestion Wheeler Ridge. takeaway capacity horizon, California PUC considering certain regulatory relief facilitate transportation natural gas Wheeler Ridge Southern California markets." Nevertheless, Breathitt urged FERC colleagues "not [to] lose sight panoply issues must consider issuing natural gas pipeline certificates." mean, however, new pipelines expansion projects, Breathitt said. "I certainly share sense urgency ensure adequate reliable energy supplies. However, Commission's mandate Natural Gas Act simply getting pipe ground." Breathitt noted Commission plans revisit issue adequacy California takeaway capacity Kern River's pending application proposed Expansion Project [CP01-422]. JASON LEOPOLD DOW JONES NEWSWIRES LOS ANGELES (Dow Jones)--The California Independent System Operator expected file petition federal regulators Friday seeking authority force generators bid 70% supply forward market effort reduce wholesale power costs state, according source familiar issue. official state's Electricity Oversight Board confirmed details filing. filing calls FERC set reasonable" rate large fraction suppliers' capacity, remaining supply would able earn market-based rates, according source. addition, major out-of-state generators would enter forward contracts FERC mandated rates "a significant portion expected sales." ISO Chairman Chief Executive Terry Winter hold news conference Friday morning focus possible solutions lower wholesale energy costs. expected announce bidding forward market stabilize high wholesale power costs. state's Public Utilities Commission expected make similar filing federal regulators near future, sources said. addition, forcing generators bid forward market measure would reduce market power state would protect majority utilities served generators cost impact market power, ISO said prior meetings. Market power term used economists describe generators influence power prices. According ISO report, market power occurred past summer tight power supply concentration generation ownership "allowed suppliers pivotal relatively high demand periods." 50% 60% power purchased past summer done spot market, unusually high percentage, according ISO. order mitigate market power, filing calls utilities enter two-year forward contracts generators shield daily market price fluctuations. Regulatory constraints associated forward contracting "key source high (power) costs summer 2000," according ISO report. ISO action taken without approval grid operator's board governors. Usually, majority board required approve action. EOB Official Surprised ISO Action announcement ISO's expected filing came surprise Gary Heath, executive director state's Electricity Oversight Board. Heath told Dow Jones Newswires aware filing news conference. "We're trying find what's behind this," Heath told Dow Jones Newswires. "We're sure could without board approval. came surprise." Sources said agency holding news conference attempt eclipse imminent structural changes ISO expected proposed Federal Energy Regulatory Commission next month. FERC launched investigation California's troubled power market past summer based allegations market workably competitive participants manipulate market. Energy officials blamed ISO summer's power woes. -By Jason Leopold; Dow Jones Newswires; 323-658-3874; mailto:jason.leopold@dowjones.com (END) Dow Jones Newswires 20-10-00 0307GMT Michael E. See questions Wood asked at: www.ConsultRCI.com [IMAGE] comprehensive, up-to-date map North American Power System RDI/FT Energy available [IMAGE] IssueAlert March 27, 2001 Two Coal Plants Announced Past Two Weeks Bob Bellemare Vice President, Utility Services U.S. Electric Power Point Lookout, New York, announced plans construct 249 megawatt (MW) coal fired power plant Cherry Point Whatcom County, Washington. last week, Reliant Energy Seward LLC, subsidiary Reliant Energy, announced planning constructing 520 MW circulating fluidized bed (CFB) clean-coal power plant Indiana County, Pennsylvania. Analysis: United States awakes energy policy slumber, becoming increasingly apparent days near complete reliance natural-gas-fired generation meet growing energy needs coming end. According EIA statistics, natural gas prices risen historic highs January 2001 utility deliveries exceeding $10/MMBtu, compared 1998 1999 prices floated $2 $3/MMBtu. Virtually overnight, natural gas gone one least expensive generation fuels one expensive. Since January price spike, prices settled back $4 $5.5 /MMBtu level Henry Hub futures prices, even prices would considered high twelve months ago. Coal, comparison, United States abundant fuel source, constituting 95 percent nation's fossil energy reserves. Coal prices actually dropped utility deliveries past several years according EIA statistics. 1994, coal prices averaged $28.03/short-ton ($1.37/MMbtu) compared $24.68/short-ton ($1.21/MMbtu) second quarter 2000. Although coal generation currently represents 51 percent U.S. generation production, plants recently built environmental concerns associated coal generation relatively low price natural gas throughout 1990s. 1999, U.S. coal production actually declined 2.1 percent primarily attributable large drop coal exports coupled smaller usual growth coal consumption power generation. brighter days may lie ahead coal industry. New, so-called "clean-coal" technologies tested developed. 1970s 80s pressurized fluidized bed coal combustor (PFBC) developed, removing sulfur (SO2) pollutants limiting formation nitrogen oxide (NOx) pollutants inside boiler. need scrubbers post-combustion controls eliminated technology. Texas New Mexico Power (TNP) constructed two 150 MW lignite-fired units went operational 1990 1991 based circulating fluidized bed (CFB) technology Reliant proposing 520 MW facility Pennsylvania. TNP One power plant was, however, extremely costly build. Unit 1 cost $357 million ($2,380/kW) Unit 2 cost $282.9 million ($1,886/kW) construct. Another technology developed integrated gasification-combined cycle (IGCC) technology first converts coal combustible gas, cleans gas virtually pollutants, burns gas turbine much like natural gas. 99 percent sulfur, nitrogen, particulate pollutants removed process. Three gasification power plants built Florida, Indiana, Nevada. early 1990s, PSI Energy Destec teamed construct 262 MW IGCC generating unit Wabash River Project Indiana total installation cost $592 million ($2,260/kW). 1996, TECO completed construction 250 MW IGCC generating unit Polk Power station Florida total installation cost $508 million ($2,032/kW). Japan also experimented clean-coal technologies. 1998, Hokkaido Electric Power Co. Inc. started commercial operation 75 MW PFBC power plant. Test operations carried two plants, 250 MW unit Chugoku Electric Power Co. 350 MW unit Kyushu Electric Power Co. Japan also testing pilot scale (1 MW) molten carbonate fuel cell (MCFC) Chubu Electric Power Co. site. interesting note advanced technologies historically approached installation cost nuclear plant, operational costs coal plant. market conditions changed, despite high capital operating costs, clean-coal technologies economically compete natural-gas-fired generation, gas prices continue remain high. Additionally, expectations next generation clean-coal power plants cost significantly less early pioneers' cost. Department Energy (DOE) example, assumes IGGC power plant built $1,315/kW average heat rate 8,470 Btu/kWh "Annual Energy Outlook 2000" report. DOE deserves great deal credit bringing clean-coal technology point commercialization. 1984, clean-coal experiment began response U.S./Canadian transboundary problem acid March 1987, President Reagan agreed new $5 billion public-private initiative make clean-coal technologies reality. program led 40 projects 18 states, including co-funding demonstration projects TECO facilities. mid-1980s options reducing NOx pollution cost $3,000 per ton; today's low NOx reduced cost $200/ton. low NOx burners also reduced emission levels 700 parts per million (ppm) early 1970s 100 ppm today. Furthermore, Selective Catalytic Reduction (SCR) process reduces 80% NOx contained coal combustion gas. DOE reports 75 percent coal-fired capacity country outfitted low-NOx burners. Similarly, cost scrubbing technology, removes sulfur pollutants, reduced 75 percent since 1970s. improvement power generation efficiency one important technical issues coal power plants high carbon content. latest commercial plant achieved thermal efficiency 43 percent increasing steam temperature pressure. Even improved efficiencies, coal power plant future may still unable achieve substantial greenhouse gas reductions could necessary address global climate change concerns. existing environmental regulations may also limit adoption new coal generation. SIP Call rule requires 22 Eastern states District Columbia reduce NOx emission specified amount May 2003, much reductions expected come coal-fired power plants. 1997, National Ambient Air Quality Standards particulate matter ozone adopted anticipated compliance cost full attainment estimated $37 billion per year (particulate) $10 billion per year (ozone) respectively. Supreme Court reviewing EPA rules, recently supported EPA's right regulate emissions [see 3/1/01 IssueAlert www.ConsultRCI.com]. rules significant since lead additional NOx SO2 emission reductions, two precursors fine airborne particles. Mercury reductions also contemplated. November 1999 EPA filed lawsuits seven utility companies Clean Air Act violations. settlement TECO, TECO agreed cut NOx SO2 emissions 85 percent 2010 pay $3.5 million civil penalty. end, nation likely turn coal help meet growing energy demands. Great strides made reduce environmental impact abundant fuel source. Since 1970, use coal doubled emissions sulfur nitrogen pollutants declined 70 percent 40 percent, respectively. continue achieve even greater emission reductions, coal may well help provide energy bridge future. archive list previous IssueAlerts available www.ConsultRCI.com Reach thousands utility analysts decision makers every day. company schedule sponsorship IssueAlert contacting Nancy Spring via e-mail calling (505)244-7613. Best, Jeff ----- Forwarded Jeff Dasovich/NA/Enron 12/22/2000 01:43 PM ----- Scott Stoness@EES 12/22/2000 01:14 PM To: Jeff Dasovich/NA/Enron@Enron, Roger Yang/SFO/EES@EES, Gordon Savage/HOU/EES@EES, Harry Kingerski/NA/Enron@Enron cc: Subject: draft testimony Gov Pitch *********** Steve: angle much better corporation, lot might "mastering obvious," is. - Rob ----------------------------------------------------- petroleum, natural gas, electricity price situations different set facts common demoninator--very tight infrastructure relative energy demand. general set conclusions "sound bites." * current energy price situation "all economics." economics 101--supply demand. Demand rising faster supply predictable response. bad news consumers. good news reason believe prices oil natural gas top commodity price cycle. NYMEX futures market shows "backwardation curve" both--look daily Wall Street Journal Section C "Futures Prices" usually around page 14. Look settle price different energy commodities prices prompt month (October) fall next months years except winter's natural gas price. * Big oil suddenly get big greedy petroleum prices "big gas" natural gas. Many players profit-maximizing previous price slump. * constraint energy markets resource base infrastructure produce, refine, transport supplies. Infrastructure constraints cumulative effect slowing great engine market supply, reflected siting issues also low profitability (partly result rapid implementation new environmental requirements). * solution stop taking supply granted build flexibility incentives system profitably meet ever-rising demand. Energy investment must compete many New Economy investment opportunities potentially high rates return. Oil global market declining U.S. production small part world supply, real constraint domestic refining capacity. Since 1990, operable U.S. refineries declined 205 159 50 refineries closed 4 new refineries entered market. [National Petroleum Council, "U.S. Petroleum Refining," June 2000, p. 23. refineries able expand increase overall capacity, capacity utilization risen rapidly recent years 95%--a tight situation. EPA permits expansion major issue making sure domestic infrastructure keeps demand (p. 27). number proposed improve environmental quality gasoline raised profitability questions well (pp. 27-30). two actions U.S. take short run increase crude supplies lift embargo Iraq withdraw oil Strategic Petroleum Reserve (up 3 mmbd). Liquidating reserve could part privatization program get support free market community, proceeds could used help low income energy users days get much "rainy" given without price controls price supply question "emergency." longer approach must encourage domestic international drilling make supply response elastic possible higher prices. Alaska activity drilling Arctic National Wildlife Reserve (ANWR) would major contribution world supplies. gasoline side, much written "boutique fuels" certain environmental requirements required certain regions makes supply/demand balance sensitive interruptions (such refinery downtime pipeline closure). key prevent price spikes consumers let new environmental requirements outrace technology infrastructure constraints. discontinuity earlier summer Chicago, example, gasoline prices rose well $2 gallon. Electricity infrastructure problem could alleviated efficient use transmission grid get power highest valued uses. California particular followed "soft" energy path conservation substituted permitting urgency new power plants. digital age driving demand growth although traditional appliances (such refrigerators) using less power. General economic growth also means many new appliances, traditional new, produced used, adding power demand. Natural Gas Natural gas supplies (and infrastructure degree) must catch high demand many years slumping gas prices reduced incentive. 200 Tcf potential gas reserves areas limits drilling--something corrected given advances drilling technology make exploration production much less invasive surface area ever before. public policy drivers continued emphasis expedited certification new pipelines avoiding new short run regulatory "fixes." Past winter, however, gas prices expected decline, consumers lock long term prices current prices. Conclusion Energy supply infrastructure taken granted long. assumed low prices would continue despite increasing disincentives increase infrastructure meet demand. Demand also increased faster thought due economic prosperity "wealth effect." Market forces correct imbalance time without regulatory quick fixes reasonable incentives industry performance. Robert L. Online Exchanges Spring New Regulations.(Commodity Futures Modernization Act, OnExchange Inc., True Quote L.L.C.)(Brief Article) 01/04/2001 Oil Daily ITEM01004008 Copyright 2001 Gale Group. rights reserved. COPYRIGHT 2001 Energy Intelligence Group Exchanges Spring Action New Regulations Electronic energy exchanges moving quickly take advantage new US legislation clarified rules regulating futures over-the-counter (OTC) markets. reforms took effect late last month legislation squeezed Congress signed outgoing President Clinton. One start-up company, Massachusetts-based OnExchange, says first exchange registered new legislation, applied regulatory Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) several months before. OnExchange start trading futures financial markets, also plans act clearinghouse energy transactions. True Quote, electronic energy exchange, also received CFTC clarification status new rules. legislation comes two-year drive derivatives markets. long twisted process quite over: CFTC withdrawn set similar reforms order bring full compliance new law. CFTC reforms due take effect mid-February; agency said revised "promptly." legislation, Commodity Futures Modernization Act, pushed Congress part appropriations bill, law Dec. 21. loosens rules futures exchanges, gives OTC contracts greater legal standing, encourages development electronic trading platforms. result, energy traders enjoy greater choice products venues, new exchanges face lower barriers entry less regulation. changes also point complex energy market, near term least, well greater challenges price discovery. CFTC's revised proposals include detail, example, exactly apply registration. also adopt legislation's terminology, names three new tiers futures exchanges. top tier, called "designated contract markets," match current futures markets New York Mercantile Exchange (Nymex), allow retail participation. second rank, "registered derivatives transaction execution facilities," largely limited institutional trade, require looser regulation. third tier, escapes regulation, known "exempt boards Energy platforms qualify last category. CFTC also encourages establishment independent clearinghouses - act central counterparty reduce financial risk - must register agency. legislation encourages online activity limiting CFTC jurisdiction derivatives contracts so-called "exempt commodities" - essentially, energy, metals - traded electronic platforms. clause, Section 106, applies contracts traded experienced, institutional traders. effectively limits oversight requirements preventing fraud manipulation. Exchanges may required disseminate data prices trading volumes, significant influence wider market. cover bilaterally traded instruments, multilateral activities still something gray area. Basically, electronic exchange handling multilateral trades energy derivatives apply CFTC official status, thinks bring credibility legal standing. However, derivatives exchange register CFTC pursued. OnExchange classified CFTC designated contract market recognized clearing organization. firm specializes technology clearing commodity financial derivatives. start trading futures contracts US treasuries, plans firm recently agreed another start-up, EnergyClear, develop electronic clearing services energy industry. EnergyClear joint venture Bank New York energy Amerex Prebon Yamane. True Quote, Kentucky-based electronic platform specializing physical financial energy trade, recently completed development online platform. signing users plans start trading North American contracts natural gas, electricity, coal first quarter. True Quote also activate agreement Enron, connecting system EnronOnline platform. True Quote looking expand European gas power year. products review include carbon emissions, weather derivatives, bandwidth. considering oil moment, spokeswoman said. LONDON -(Dow Jones)- Copper futures traded London fell Friday, influx stocks official warehouses put copper market pressure dragged rest base metal complex. However, world domestic crop concerns, strength dollar general bullish sentiment carry markets fresh highs short term, said. LONDON, July 13 (Reuters) Britain's largest companies raced higher close Friday fired telecoms drug stocks bounced back Wednesday's 16-week low. Index heavyweights Vodafone GlaxoSmithKline provided 27 day's 55-point gain, technology firms wobbled. However, telecoms giant surged 4.1 percent 157-1/4p. FTSE 100 finished 55.4 points one percent firmer 5,537.0, jumped 1.66 percent Thursday seven consecutive losing sessions, gainers outnumbering losers three one. Futures Contract Covering Coal Debuts New York (Correct) 2001-07-13 08:48 (New York) Futures Contract Covering Coal Debuts New York (Correct) (Corrects location FirstEnergy Corp. 10th paragraph story moved yesterday.) New York, July 12 (Bloomberg) -- New York Mercantile Exchange today began trading futures contract low-sulfur coal, fuel President George W. Bush said play major role meeting electricity demand next two decades. contract's debut came prices coal, considered dirtiest power-plant fuels, doubled past year, demand power plants outstripped mine production. Coal September delivery opened $42 ton settled $40.75, 98 contracts traded, exchange officials said. ``We big run-up coal prices past winter,'' said Andy Ozley, buys coal Atlanta-based Mirant Corp.'s six coal plants New York, Illinois, Maryland Virginia. ``This contract affords us way mitigate exposure'' large price swings. Bush administration said energy policy report spring coal would dominant fuel electricity generation 2020. Bush gave added boost fuel retreated campaign pledge restrict carbon dioxide emissions, implicated global warming. Coal plants responsible third nation's carbon dioxide emissions. also produce sulfur dioxide, causes acid rain, nitrogen oxides, cause smog. Nymex started futures contract give mining companies utilities way hedge risks $33 billion coal market. Producers Peabody Energy Corp. Arch Coal Inc., whose shares soared past year, said would trade futures. New Plants Last year's quadrupling prices natural gas -- cleaner-burning power-plant fuel -- prompted many generators ramp output coal plants. Utility coal stockpiles dwindled, prices risen highest levels since least 1989. far year, dozen companies announced plans build coal-fired plants, including Kansas City, Missouri- based Kansas City Power & Light Co. Portland, Oregon-based PacifiCorp. Although coal used produce 52 percent nation's electricity, plants built 1990s high costs building difficulty complying federal local environmental regulations. coal eased recent weeks below-normal temperatures U.S. Midwest Northeast reduced demand air conditioning, said Jim Parks, buys coal six power plants Ohio Pennsylvania fuels Akron, Ohio-based FirstEnergy Corp. ``The summer's pretty mild far -- seen big heat waves'' regions coal generation, said. Big Sandy Nymex futures contract calls delivery 1,550 tons low-sulfur coal mouth Big Sandy River near Huntington, West Virginia. there, fuel would loaded onto Ohio River barges shipped power plants U.S. possibly Europe. new contract tailored producers Appalachian states account 40 percent U.S. production, including West Virginia, Kentucky Pennsylvania, No. 2, 3 4 coal producers. industry lacks futures contract coal Western states account 47 percent nation's production, including No. 1 producer, Wyoming. Avoiding Past exchange, earns commissions trades, hopes coal futures avoid fate contracts started past years. six electricity futures contracts fizzled, Middle East sour crude oil contract, debuted May 2000. ``I traded 100 200 contracts, would really good day,'' said Chris Casale, vice president energy trading Dynegy Inc. Houston, trades coal buys fuel six power plants New York Illinois. ``It came sort target.'' today's trading originated large energy marketing companies, said, although declined say whether Dynegy traded contracts. Enron Corp., largest energy trader, Duke Energy Corp., largest U.S.-based utility holding company, said would trade coal futures. Exchange officials said coal market potential reach 5,000 trades day year trading. Nymex's 17-year-old crude oil futures contract averages 66,700 trades day, 11-year-old natural gas contract averages 33,500. Wary Coal ``The coal market still lacking liquidity,'' said Anthony McAuley, floor broker ABN Amro Inc., said bought five coal contracts client $42 ton -- market's first transaction. ``You probably need see little participation'' industry coal buyers sellers market take off. Independent floor traders, known locals, wary trading coal futures without assurances industry active well. ``Floor traders lost millions'' electricity futures caught high-priced nobody industry sell to, said. ``Because that, people little bit tentative coal,'' said Tom Schiff, independent crude oil trader. ``We're help make liquidity can't tackle risk.'' Testimony identify current rate structures proposed Commission proceedings may prevent hinder deployment distributed generation, rate structures could modified facilitate distributed generation deployment. Parties discuss among rate design issues: stranded costs, bypass, customer grid charges, standby rates, PBR flexible pricing mechanisms. rate design issues related interconnection costs addressed. Issues include recovery allocation, pay costs interconnect distribution system interconnection studies, costs incurred distributed generation customers specific circuit feeder shared subsequent distributed generation customers connecting facilities. attachment (Attachment A) provides 36 questions framework issues Commission consider Phase 2 proceeding. Enron's first-quarter revenues 281%, Calpine's revenues net income 400%--even California's deadbeat utility PG&E owing company $300 million. decade contraction business, companies shut offices New Orleans Oklahoma, deregulation new marketing strategies sparking Houston's renaissance. "Enron leading new energy industry. Ten years ago, trading floors," points Stephen Brown, senior economist Federal Reserve Bank Dallas. Calpine Reliant also trading operations new offices. Though Houston longer relies heavily energy business (down 48% local economy 82% 1982) turnaround sure feels good city lost 15,000 energy-sector jobs two years ago, says Barton Smith, director Institute Regional Forecasting University Houston. gained jobs back, plus some. Says Smith: "The current boom what's keeping Houston afloat rest country suffering." None matters real Houston lovers, course. They're interested bragging rights. bad decade, they're beginning sound like biggest best Texas again. "Boomlet?" says Laura Schwartz, spokeswoman Enron. "It's mini-boom. boom." Credit derivatives , first used United States 1991, used banks reduce risk exposure certain credits loans. typical credit-linked note transaction, protection seller (Bank A) assumes credit risk protection buyer (Bank B) return stream regular interest payments. Bank B assume default risk pre-selected asset Bank acquire credit exposure reference asset (in case, notes) Bank B. Section 3.3.2 MAS notice 627, seller required sum risk-weighted exposures notes Bank B. capital charge 12 per cent applied aggregate credit exposure, resulting uniform 24 per cent capital charge protection selling banks. would clearly excessive, says MAS, especially reference assets high credit quality. June last year, Basel Committee Banking Supervision proposed risk-sensitive standardised approach. Pending finalisation new framework, protection selling banks unduly penalised, MAS said. address concern, protection sellers allowed apply higher risk charges appropriate reference asset protection buyer, subject condition rated investment grade higher (BBB-and above). credit rating either fall investment grade, dual capital must applied credit exposures. reference asset protection buyer rated, MAS may waive dual charge rule case-by-case basis. However, must shown risk faced seller adequately addressed single capital charge. "The rule impact Singapore banks right enter high amount credit derivatives. ... make things transparent telling banks treat notes balance sheets," said Joe Toh, credit analyst UOB Asia. Kloffe Launches KLSE CI Options Contract Business Times (Malaysia) - December 1, 2000 Debra Moreira Kuala Lumpur Options Financial Futures Exchange Bhd (Kloffe) today launches second product - KLSE CI (Kuala Stock Exchange Composite Index) options contract. move part plan increase products enhance liquidity market. Kloffe hoping product attract local foreign institutional support subsequently assist towards building attracting liquidity. Kloffe, wholly-owned subsidiary KLSE, first derivatives exchange Malaysia. Kloffe also introducing additional two products first quarter 2001, placing high importance futures products based Islamic index. "It (the options contract) good step forward developing interest hopefully bring back foreign investors. step right direction," Ramli said. Although huge initial demand product expected, Kloffe expects product grow gradually people get used it. "Kloffe recognises critical market participants properly educated ensure sufficient understanding use derivatives products fully equipped manage investment portfolios," said Ramli. such, Kloffe currently undertaking comprehensive marketing educational programme KLSE CI Options launch promote existing product. option provides holder/buyer right, without obligation, purchase (call) sell (put) quantity specific underlying instrument stipulated price within specific period time. acquire right, holder/buyer pays minimal price known option premium seller (also called writer) option. futures contract however, agreement two parties buy sell underlying instrument specific time future specific price determined today. CFTC Rules Could Change Futures Industry; Question Bridge News - November 29, 2000 Mary Haffenberg months anticipation, new regulatory rules released last week pave way changes exchanges list derivatives contracts. proposals also open door new electronic trading platforms clearing organizations jump derivatives listing clearing business. rules interpreted without making law leaving industry players wary. Commodity Futures Trading Commission, regulator U.S. derivatives markets, last week approved rules first proposed February create new regulatory framework futures markets. rules, go effect 60 days first appear Federal Register, create three regulatory tiers various futures contracts swaps products established markets fall. idea three tiers match degree regulation varying nature products customers trading markets. new rules, three regulatory tiers recognized futures exchanges, derivatives transactions facilities exempt multilateral transaction execution facilities. Products within RFE category, example, allow retail participation contracts customer protection regulatory safeguards attached them. bill passed House Representatives October stalled Senate would make law CFTC rule changes. bill also would legalize single stock futures, provide legal certainty over-the-counter markets, take CFTC rule changes even farther areas make changes within power CFTC. bill, Commodity Futures Modernization Act 2000, overcome significant obstacles Senate pass Congress returns next month finish work, bill would supercede CFTC rules. CFTC rules go effect least end January beginning February (as Wednesday, still listed Federal Register), lawyers others reading rules hurry digest interpret them. addition, lot could change lawmakers pass futures modernization act. Market participants established exchanges like idea less regulated markets costs business expected decrease. However, clearing groups still must regulated banking laws, foreign regulators Securities Exchange Commission. Web Bond-Trade Systems Draw Regulators' Scrutiny Wall Street Journal - December 1, 2000 Randall Smith Gregory Zuckerman Antitrust regulators launched investigation online bond-trading foreign-exchange systems owned several Wall Street's biggest securities firms examine whether trading platforms used limit competition. Several top securities firms, including Goldman Sachs Group Inc., Merrill Lynch & Co., Morgan Stanley Dean Witter & Co., Salomon Smith Barney unit Citigroup Inc. received requests information part investigation, conducted antitrust division U.S. Department Justice. firms either comment said cooperating. Justice Department spokesman said agency "looking competitive effects certain joint ventures online bond-trading industry online foreign exchange." inquiry reported Thursday Bond Buyer newspaper Web site Industry Standard, magazine covers Internet economic issues. Ralph C. Ferrara, lawyer specializing securities regulation New York law firm Debevoise & Plimpton, said probe raises "an interesting issue," commonly owned utility boosts price transparency entire market, simultaneously gives firms look other's market strategies "is something Jekyll Hyde." requests information, known civil investigative demands, involve recent formation several online bond foreign-exchange portals Wall Street's biggest firms various combinations, people familiar matter say. "I think interest largest firms involved" together, said John Ladensack, bond chief Schwab Capital Markets unit San Francisco discount brokerage firm Charles Schwab Corp. Schwab, forming bond-trading portal, avoided participation online marketplaces "because dominance big players," Mr. Ladensack said. probe Justice Department investigation inner workings Wall Street. Another pending inquiry, disclosed early 1999, focusing prevalence 7% underwriting fee initial public offerings less $100 million size. Federal regulators looked antitrust implications wide range Internet marketplaces, cars real estate airline tickets. American Society Travel Agents, example, asked Justice Department investigate online service owned several airlines, saying would drive travel agents business. Federal Trade Commission approved car-parts Web site set Big Three auto makers. Electronic bond trading growing, yet catch on. activity represents 3% 6% overall bond trading, according Tower Group, technology-research firm, 2% last year. "It's worth investigating area. questions markets turn electronic whether dealers control market place," says Larry Tabb, group director Tower Group. "The concern see other's bids artificially manipulate prices, create electronic market that's open participants, far looks like they're letting others in." Two best-known upstart online-bond systems sponsored leading Wall Street firms deal corporate bonds BondBook LLC Market Axess LLC. Another big online trading firms TradeWeb LLC, owned group including Goldman Sachs, Lehman Brothers Group Holdings Inc. Credit Suisse First Boston unit Credit Suisse Group. TradeWeb's trading volume represents 7% 10% dealer-to-customer transactions U.S. Treasury market, 2% year ago, according Tower Group, although TradeWeb officials say figure higher. TradeWeb's online system, investors contact many five dealers time send orders buy sell Treasurys government-agency securities. Investors also compare prices five firms. dealers can't see bond quotes rivals, according Tom Eady, chief operating officer TradeWeb. Mr. Eady says firm contacted Department Justice; securities executives said Justice probe appear encompass Treasury bonds. End ISDA Press Report Friday, December 1, 2000. True, California would heading summer power shortages even never deregulated. even workable competition wholesale electricity market, prices market would spike periods peak demand, transferring billions dollars either taxpayers consumers generators. evidence overwhelming workable competition California's power market, actions generators "gaming system" greatly magnified crisis. key fact California somehow remained state less continuous power shortage high wholesale prices regardless level demand. rash outages kept electricity market conveniently - profitably - short supply even periods low demand, ought lots excess capacity. Frank Wolak, Stanford economist also advises state's power grid, pointed out, outage power plant lot like employee calling sick. can't tell directly whether really sick chosen take day reasons, look circumstantial evidence. evidence convinced Mr. Wolak "generators use forced outages strategically withhold capacity market" - view shared growing number researchers. brings us latest move Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. Wednesday, commission apparently decided offer California relief, put new price caps place California electricity market. say "apparently" look plan less likely seems help all. Indeed, measure passed 2-to-1 vote, William Massey - one commissioner sympathetic calls price controls - voting grounds would ineffectual. What's wrong FERC's plan? First, caps prices emergency conditions - ignoring fact electricity prices stayed hard- to-explain levels even emergency. effect, plan laid electricity market really competitive, spite evidence not. Second, even emergency price caps full loopholes, offering extensive opportunities Mr. Wolak calls "megawatt laundering" - selling power affiliated companies one reason another exempted price controls (for example, controls apply "imports" neighboring states), selling back California market. Severin Borenstein University California Energy Institute adds allowed price depends cost generation least efficient plant, generators clear incentive produce inefficiently: "I predict find plants never heard suddenly operating again, pretty inefficient." general verdict seems serious plan. serious proposals mitigate crisis - indeed, last fall Mr. Wolak submitted proposal well received experts - FERC ignored them. charitable interpretation FERC still get it, can't bring believe time wolf real. uncharitable interpretation last week's action meant fail. Medley Report, online newsletter, calls FERC plan "a grand exercise posturing without substance . . . clever temporary move Bush administration deflect political fallout" looming disaster. Whatever explanation, plain fact FERC administration yet offer California significant relief. http://www.nytimes.com/2001/04/29/opinion/29KRUG.html?ex=989601563&ei=1&en=6a900f004b3b1abf /-----------------------------------------------------------------\ Visit NYTimes.com complete access authoritative news coverage Web, updated throughout day. California Wholesale Electricity Markets 21. 1996 California deregulated electricity industry required State's privately owned utility companies divest plants. purpose deregulation introduce competition electricity markets, intention reducing rates electrical power. fact, however, certain participants recently deregulated industry have, violation operating Tariff, taken advantage structural flaws system improperly obtained confidential competitor information artificially inflate prices electricity, yielding billions dollars windfall profits expense California consumers. 22. part deregulation, several new entities created facilitate workings new market. California's investor owned utilities, Pacific & Electric (PG&E), Southern California Edison (SCE), San Diego Gas & Electric (the"Utilities"), purchase electricity customers independent generators traders, including defendants, market known California Power Exchange (PX). PX maintains market purchase wholesale electricity variety forward contracts real time markets. California deregulatory scheme, Utilities were, recently, required purchase power PX prohibited independently power outside market. 23. deregulated also led creation California Independent System Operator (CAISO). CAISO "independent" non-profit corporation, managing board includes representatives among generators created manage flow electricity ensure reliability along long distance, high-voltage power lines make bulk California's transmission system. Approximately 75% California's electricity distributed CAISO managed "power grid". CAISO monitors electrical loads (i.e., demand) on-going basis ensures adequate supply power meet demand. / / / 24. CAISO accomplishes maintaining Real Time Imbalance Market (the "Real Time Market"). CAISO receives bids suppliers insufficient meet demand power, must accept bid, sets market-clearing price hour. single price auction system used CAISO, sellers electricity Real Time Market automatically receive market clearing price, (second) highest price paid market, even willing sell fact bid sell electricity lower prices. mechanism allows sophisticated market participants, defendants, game market withholding bids effort maximize clearing price. 25. Real Time Market designed handle large transactions, merely provide mechanism correct imbalances supply demand. Defendants nonetheless pushed substantial portion daily wholesale electricity sales market bidding capacity forward market leaving wholesale customers alternative place obtain power satisfy retail customers' demand. 26. CAISO also manages Replacement Reserve Market, used balance supply demand electricity. Sellers Replacement Reserve Market receive fixed premium available capacity. called upon ISO deliver energy, sellers Replacement Reserve Market also receive Real Time Market price. Thus, generators know capacity short, incentive withhold supplies spot markets push much possible Replacement Reserve Market. Access real time information facilitates "gaming" markets demonstrating, real time, available competing supply. 27. times high demand, CAISO authority purchase energy out-of-state sources, operative price cap. CAISO forced Summer 2000. California generators marketers export electricity surrounding markets order create artificial shortages drive prices California markets. resell electricity CAISO inflated uncapped prices. PX Compliance Committee noted November 1, 2000 Report ("the PX Compliance Report"): / / / "During periods high Out-of-Market purchases, prices Real-Time energy price cap, in-state generators incentive export energy California. Surrounding control areas effectively park energy resale CAISO Out-of-Market calls return state." Id. p. 44. 28. Notably, summer witnessed approximately 370% increase exports California energy market, despite high prices short supplies existed State. "Market power" defined CAISO ability significantly influence market prices cause vary competitive levels material period time. Generators suppliers (including defendants) exercise market power physically economically withholding electricity market, moving electricity California markets, pricing bidding resources ways impede efficiency market. 29. Notably, California energy market consists relatively small number firms, control substantial fraction total generating capacity. small number suppliers facilitates exercise market power periods high demand, even true scarcity available generating capacity. addition, relatively inelastic demand energy facilitates exercise market power. Cartwright Act states, o16726, that: "Except provided chapter, every trust unlawful, public policy void." trust defined o16720 follows: 55. "A trust combination capital, skill acts two persons following purposes: (a) create carry restrictions trade commerce. (b) limit reduce production, increase price merchandise commodity. (c) prevent competition manufacturing, making, transportation, sale purchase merchandise, produce commodity. (d) fix standard figure, whereby price public consumer shall manner controlled established, article commodity merchandise, produce commerce intended sale, barter, use consumption State. (e) make enter execute carry contracts, obligations, agreements kind description, combination following: (1) Bind sell, dispose transport article commodity article trade, use, merchandise, commerce consumption common standard figure, fixed value. (2) Agree manner keep price article, commodity transportation fixed graduated figure. (3) Establish settle price article, commodity transportation others, directly indirectly preclude free unrestricted competition among themselves, purchasers consumers sale transportation article commodity. (4) Agree pool, combine directly indirectly unite interests may connected sale transportation article commodity, price might manner affected." 56. Defendants' rates inherently excessive, invalid unconscionable, particularly light deceptive manipulative practices used inflate market prices vital need consumers businesses electrical power. / / / 88. Defendants' unconscionable prices passed Plaintiff majority Class retail electricity rates charged SDG&E thereby directly damaged Plaintiff Class. VI. PRAYER RELIEF WHEREFORE, Plaintiff Class pray judgment defendants follows: (a) Court determine action may maintained class action direct reasonable notice action given members Class; (b) combination, contract, arrangement, agreement, conspiracy trust alleged herein adjudged decreed unreasonable restraint trade violation Sections 16720 16726 California Business Professions Code; (c) damages granted according proof, Plaintiff Class awarded treble damages statutory damages, applicable, attorneys' fees, costs disbursements; (d) Plaintiff Class awarded pre- post-judgment interest; (e) Court enter appropriate injunctive equitable relief, including disgorgement defendants' unlawful profits; (f) Plaintiff Class relief Court may deem proper circumstances. (NYSE:DYN) NRG Energy, Inc. (NYSE:NRG) today announced affiliates, El Segundo Power LLC, Long Beach Generation LLC Cabrillo LLC, entered agreement California Department Water Resources (DWR) provide state 2,300 megawatts (MW) energy 2004. terms begins today, Dynegy NRG's affiliates provide 1,000 MW DWR balance 2001, beginning January 1, 2002 provide 2,300 MW. Financial terms transaction disclosed. "Since last summer, Dynegy NRG continued produce power state requested. worked diligently DWR capture value in-state generation, balanced California's long-term energy needs," said Steve Bergstrom, president chief operating officer Dynegy Inc. Craig A. Mataczynski, president chief executive officer NRG North America, said, "Today's announcement solidifies commitment eliminating uncertainty respective shareholders restoring price stability future reliability California electricity market." Dynegy Inc. leading provider energy communications solutions customers North America, United Kingdom Europe. company's leadership position extends across entire convergence value chain, power generation wholesale direct commercial industrial marketing trading power, natural gas, coal emission allowances, weather derivatives, broadband transportation, gathering processing natural gas liquids. information Dynegy visit web site www.dynegy.com. NRG Energy leading global energy company primarily engaged acquisition, development, construction, ownership operation power generation facilities. Here's attachment easy distribution: Here's full article quick scanning: Monday April 9 4:23 PM ET Power Situation State Associated Press, state-by-state look electric power situation summer: Alabama: Blackouts rolling brownouts unlikely utilities required maintain reserve 15 percent needed meet peak demand. Residential business customers pay rates 1.1 percent year ago. Alaska: Blackouts brownouts unlikely. Hydroelectric power plentiful, generating systems taxed. Electric bills expected fall slightly. Arizona: little likelihood power interruption. Utilities prepared handle summer electricity demand, price caps prevent major utilities increasing rates. Arkansas: Blackouts rolling brownouts highly unlikely. Electric bills expected rise 5 percent increased fuel costs passed customers summer expected even hotter year ago, readings topped 111 degrees Little Rock. California: Forecasts tight power supplies throughout West energy experts California warning statewide rolling blackouts summer. Power grid managers say concerted conservation efforts, accelerated construction new power plants ``a bit luck'' could help avoid blackouts. Grid managers already ordered rotating blackouts four days since January. Los Angeles likely spared L.A. Department Water Power provides generation connected state's grid. Colorado: state unlikely experience blackouts brownouts 93 percent power comes coal-fired plants. fixed, long-term contracts coal, producers anticipate fuel cost adjustments. Connecticut: brownouts blackouts anticipated. Brownouts possible, though, prolonged spike usage power plants down. Utilities mandatory price rate cap. Delaware: Enough power available avoid blackouts brownouts, questions linger whether utilities deliver it. Power undergoing deregulation Delaware officials concerned possibility increased costs. However, 1998 deregulation law, cost electricity temporarily capped. Florida: Power outages unlikely summer state reserves 20 percent. Utility companies already increased rates cover higher fuel costs. Unless coal oil wholesale prices increase sharply, consumers expect major rate increases. Georgia: Blackouts brownouts unlikely state for-profit regulatory system gives suppliers incentive build generating plants. Rising costs natural gas, fuels almost new electric plants, could increase residential electric bills 25 percent. Hawaii: little likelihood blackouts, rolling brownouts price spikes. island state, Hawaii's electricity system connected states. island generation system supply sufficient meet demand. Idaho: little chance blackouts rolling brownouts bills rising. state's largest utility wants 34 percent increase residential rates. Illinois: Blackouts rolling brownouts unexpected generating increased number small ``peaker'' plants. Homeowners rate increase, either; electricity rates locked 2004 state's deregulation plan. Indiana: expectation blackouts brownouts unless weeks hot weather power plant stops operating. Utility companies urging conserve energy believe maintain remaining state energy surpluses, decreased 30 percent 10 percent past decade. Iowa: state expect blackouts summer, problems could occur early 2002 serious capacity problems 2006. single-digit price increases expected summer. Kansas: Blackouts rolling brownouts unlikely. Kansas never regional blackout. size electric bills hot gets much power customers use air conditioning. State law prohibits price spikes regulated utilities, supply 70 percent residential customers. Kentucky: Electricity rates state among lowest nation, likely rise 3.2 percent 3.8 percent 2003, largely due pollution control equipment upgrades. adequate supply avoid brownouts blackouts summer. Louisiana: blackouts expected summer utility officials say state verge power crisis unless plants built. Consumer say bills likely increase much 30 percent high natural gas prices hot summer forecast. Maine: Five new natural gas-fired power plants line coming line soon, reducing prospect rolling blackouts. consumer rate increases expected. Maryland: Public Service Commission expect service interruptions believes electricity rates rise. electric deregulation plan implemented last year reduced, froze, rates homes businesses. Massachusetts: brownouts unlikely New England added half dozen new power plants past months - enough supply outpace demand surges. Residents likely see hefty rate hikes winter, including much 42 percent consumers. Michigan: state law signed last year deregulate electricity industry 2002, utilities cut rates 5 percent must cap rates five years. Although demand electricity 2 percent 3 percent utilities say enough supply meet demand. Minnesota: blackouts rolling brownouts likely unless extended heat wave power plant failure. Electricity costs expected remain steady. Many customers, however, spend summer months paying natural gas electricity bills long, cold winter. Mississippi: Blackouts summer unlikely. two main power suppliers taking measures reserves peak summer months new independent generating plants also available. Mississippi Power expects bills customers 3 percent 6 percent summer. Entergy, another filed summer rate plan yet. Missouri: Utilities plenty generating capacity supply contracts, service interruptions expected. state Service Commission says three large utilities bringing new expanded generating plants line. State law bars rate spikes PSC-regulated utilities, customer bills reflect higher generating costs. Montana: Blackouts rolling brownouts expected. Montana Power customers price increases summer company virtual rate freeze July 2002. Flathead Electric's rates rose 29 percent April 1 additional 60 percent increase possible two companies serve half customers Montana. Nebraska: rolling blackouts expected. Electric bills expected increase since state's largest utility already increased rates 2 percent 4 percent. Nevada: Major utilities expecting blackouts rolling brownouts, monthly electricity bills two power companies go 1 percent 2 percent month September, based already-authorized incremental rate increases. State lawmakers, reacting California's energy crisis, processing measures would block deregulation taking effect. Gov. Kenny Guinn also said let deregulation take effect 1997 1999 laws unless he's confident consumers harmed. New Hampshire: Blackouts unlikely customers may conserve power hot days. part deregulation, rates drop 12 percent customers state's largest electric utility. rates could rise 20 percent 30 percent customers second-largest utility. New Jersey: Blackouts unlikely protections included 2-year-old energy deregulation law. Rates capped 2003. However, regulators allowed utilities raise natural gas rates summer, 2 percent month July, make money lost winter skyrocketing fuel prices. New Mexico: state escape power outages rate increases summer months. New York: head potential power shortfalls New York City, New York Power Authority rushing finish construction 11 small natural gas turbines. Upstate New York's largest utility says enough power avoid blackouts brownouts summer. Rates regulated across much state, New York City customers pay market prices. North Carolina: blackouts rolling brownouts expected. major rate cases pending state among large, regulated utilities. North Dakota: state exports 70 percent electricity produced seven coal-fired power plants facing power shortages summer. Electricity bills power air conditioners expected double previous summer way natural gas bills doubled winter. Ohio: blackouts rolling brownouts expected unless long heat wave. Prices residential customers remain flat next five years part deregulation plan took effect Jan. 1. Oklahoma: little likelihood blackouts rolling brownouts May September, Oklahoma Gas & Electric, 700,000 customers state northwestern Arkansas, expects electricity bills 10 percent 15 percent last summer. Thanks, David Mims *********** Richard - response memo dated 7/18/00: First I'm confused attorney's letter dated 6/27/00 regarding reference per share prices $8.68 and/or $4.34. clue number came from. Nowhere Securities Purchase Agreement (SPA) reference "per share" price. Sec. 2.03 prices referenced millions dollars aggregate format. Pursuant Sec. 2 Securities Purchase Agreement (SPA) dated 7/14/99 ECTMI purchased selling shareholders +/- 85% stock Ecogas Initial Payment $23.75 million. amount $3 million withheld [pursuant Sec. 2.03(g)] pending Ecogas' successful termination Montauk's "right first offer" 12/31/99. milestone achieved March 28, 2000 restructuring various Ecogas/Montauk/GSF (the former jv partnership Ecogas Montauk) issues completed. Therefore, $24 million Initial Payment, $3 million forfeited Ecogas' inability meet obligations pursuant SPA. summary, Article II, Secs. 2.03(b) (c) SPA includes provisions Intermediate Payment Final Payment, respectively, subject certain milestones met. milestones described basically two-part test. first criteria requires Ecogas producing selling excess 27,000 MMBtu/d natural gas (methane) second criteria requirement Ecogas son profitable manner (i.e., EBITDA test). test criteria applicable Intermediate Final payments means criteria would satisfied 4/14/00 1/14/01. theory, payments criteria requirements part complex calculations involving translation number defined terms within SPA. SPECIAL TERMS CONDITIONS 1. discount rate shall apply points utilized original shipper entering transportation agreement Northwest. 2. shipper allowed release and/or segment release capacity shipper replacement shipper may utilize available points Northwest's transmission system without impacting discount original shipper. 3. prearranged offer reservation contract demand rate.˜ addition Reservation Charge Bid, shipper pay volumetric charge, applicable surcharges fuel. PROCEDURE BIDDING AVAILABLE TRANSPORTATION CAPACITY following guidelines adhered posted packages transportation capacity electronic bid ("package packages"): 1. Shipper must submit separate electronic bid package available transportation capacity.˜ Multiple electronic bid(s) submitted total available transportation capacity specified package multiple rates submitted partial amount available transportation capacity specified package.˜ Shipper submits multiple bids, highest present value package available transportation capacity shall considered valid bid. bids Shipper package transportation capacity discarded. 2. Northwest awards bids based net present value calculation.˜ bid rate less minimum tariff rate, following formula utilized:˜ Bid Rate x FERC Interest Rate x Maximum Bid Quantity x 365 days/100/12; maximum rate bid, following formula utilized:˜ Bid Rate x FERC Interest Rate Maximum Bid x days bid/100. case tie, tied right improve bid submitting improved bid within 24 hours bid close time.˜ improved bid shall faxed (801) 584-7076 Candace Karpakis Patrick Aman.˜ tie still exists, capacity shall awarded prorata basis. 3. Northwest accept bids primary contract term (Term) longer indicated capacity unless rate bid. INSTRUCTIONS CREATING BID NORTHWEST'S FIRM CAPACITY RELEASE OFFERS 1. Select "CAPACITY RELEASE" application Northwest Passage. 2. Select "CREATE/SUB BID NWP CAP" application.˜ current offers appear. 3. Highlight offer interested clicking left mouse button offer. 4. Select "TERMS & COND" button top screen, active.˜ screen allow review conditions offer.˜ Close screen finished reviewing. 5. point review current bids posted offer selecting "VIEW BID" button.˜ Close screen finished viewing. 6. would like create bid offer, select "CREATE BID" button. 7. want bid maximum rate capacity, select "BID MAX RATE" button. 8. Highlight "END DATE" want modify end date term offer. 9. want modify receipt/delivery point maximum minimum volume, highlight receipt/delivery point section left mouse button modify accordingly. Select error appears button screen, error need corrected data need saved again.˜ successful, message appear indicating bid information saved bid rate must entered.˜ Select "OK". 10. Select "RATE" button.˜ Enter bid rate.˜ Select "SAVE". ˜˜˜˜˜˜˜ "CREATED" bid offer.˜ need "SUBMIT" ˜˜˜˜˜˜˜ bid follows: 11. Close screens return "CAPACITY RELEASE" menu screens. 12. Submit Review bid(s), select "REV/SUB/WDRW NWP CAP BID" button.˜ bids appear.˜ Highlight "BID DRAFT STATUS" would like submit Select "SUBMIT" button top screen post bid. Withdraw bid(s), select "REV/SUB/WDRW NWP CAP" button.˜ bids appear.˜ bid yet submitted, highlight "BID DRAFT STATUS" would like withdraw.˜ Select "WITHDRAW" button top screen withdraw bid.˜ bid withdrawn, select "DELETE" button top screen delete screen. NOTE:˜ selection, always screen get latest status.
