Jim PHYSICAL POSITION CALIFORNIA EES electricity customers within territories SCE, PG&E, SDG&E (about 800 MW usage) [NOTE - CHECK EES]. natural gas customers within territories PG&E SoCal Gas. Enron generation California (we small QF Nevada 50 MW excess). supply power Utilities retail load buying excess California transmitting power state. Enron sells natural gas mainly spot arrangements. Enron continues manage risk using traditional hedging tools using full complement resources EES - demand reduction, load shaping, efficiency improvements. long-term capacity arrangements PG&E. POLITICAL POSITION CALIFORNIA / MESSAGES current situation (shortages potential bankruptcy) result competitive markets, rather result barriers workable retail wholesale markets designed California deregulation model (for instance, overreliance Utilities spot market, residual CTC calculation, incomplete retail tariff unbundling requiring direct access customers pay fair share Utilities' common costs). Enron want see California Utilities go bankrupt naysayers competition use situation argument competition. Enron disagrees. proves finishing job creating real competition result problems. Enron believes workable short-term long-term California. short-term, (1) California must provide credit enhancement directly buy power Utilities' needs ensure stable supply electricity, (2) California incent customers institute demand reductions, (3) California raise rates cover reasonable costs Utilities petition bankruptcy. long-term, (1) California needs continue activities promote retail competition (and importantly must allow real price signals large customers), (2) California implement changes FERC (end reliance spot market, remove stakeholders Cal ISO Board, give Utilties ability recover wholesale power costs), (3) California must remove unnecessary barriers development additional generation capacity, and, importantly, (4) California must establish reasonable structures Utilities develop balanced portfolio supplies better manage electricity market volatility. California get business owning operating generation assets transmission facilities. California stop moving forward retail competitition customers manage price risk rather regulator. Southern California's current "energy crisis" simply result ever-increasing demand growing population energy. Rather, direct result conspiracy among natural industry's powerful Southern California players preserve maintain market dominance enjoyed many years monopolies subject regulation. artificial monopoly created regulation disassembled, dominant companies took prompt illegal action ensure would lose benefits market power. unlawful collusion contributed recent astronomical increases price natural gas electricity. result, Southern California customers pay billions dollars extra natural gas electric needs. lawsuit seeks recover damages. (Para. 1 2 complaint.) "In September 1996, top executives Southern California Gas Company ("SoCal Gas"), San Diego Gas &amp; Electric ("SDG&amp;E") El Paso Natural Gas Corporation ("EPNG") met Embassy Suites Hotel, near Sky Harbor Airport Arizona. Fearing new era open competition lower prices, latter day captains industry gathered secretly hatch conspiracy dominate unregulated aspects natural gas electricity markets. meeting, three companies, together dominate Southern California natural gas market, illegally agreed compete Southern California Baja California natural gas delivery markets. also conspired prevent pipelines built would competed lowered natural gas prices markets. conspirators sought eliminate competition, take advantage electric deregulation, drive price natural gas, profit increased prices." (Para 4 complaint.) One two lawsuits addresses effects conspiracy natural gas prices; deals effects electricity prices. (The price gas-fired generation establishes price electricity used Southern California.) Handler &amp; Shaeffer LLP, 213-532-2000 Web site: http://oslaw.com/osnews E SOURCE Study: Customer-Side Electricity Demand Reduction Could Stem Rising Power Prices BOULDER, Colo., Dec. 18 /PRNewswire/ via NewsEdge Corporation - electricity prices rising like floodwaters California states, limited generation capacity garnered attention culprit. Many see constructing new power plants sole solution bringing prices down. However, SOURCE research field indicates convincing customers reduce electricity demand cash could provide tremendous price relief open power markets. "Our study commercial industrial customers willing reduce demand price right, mechanisms place communicating prices, means controlling electric loads. found larger customers could offer almost 20 percent load negawatts -- temporary reductions electricity demand," says E SOURCE Vice President Bill LeBlanc. electricity use considered essential wholesale prices immediately affect end users, prices go sky high power supplies get tight. demand dropped response high prices, LeBlanc contends overall power costs would much lower. explains, "Although there's disconnect price demand marketplace today, we've uncovered significant subset customers seem ready participate dynamic pricing market. Unfortunately, yet communication control tools would make load management possible. also offered pricing product like." E SOURCE research study confirms customers want flexibility deciding whether participate load reductions daily even hourly basis, example. many negawatts available? According E SOURCE national market survey, medium-to-large commercial industrial customers could potentially reduce demand 18 percent offered market price $1 per kWh (one tested price points) reduced electricity usage. price -- incidentally, Edison International CEO President John Bryson reported company paid electricity December 12 wholesale power markets -- 55,000 MW could made available across U.S., 4,800 MW California. LeBlanc adds, "We can't expect capture potential. right product, pricing scheme, marketing, would possible help relieve price pressure whole system." USA: FACTBOX-FERC details changes Calif power market. 11/01/2000 Reuters English News Service (C) Reuters Limited 2000. WASHINGTON, 1 (Reuters) - Federal Energy Regulatory approved several actions revamp California's power market next two years. Immediate changes include following: * Eliminate requirement three utilities - Pacific Gas & Electric, San Diego Power SoCal Edison - must sell power buy power state Power (PX). * Require market participants schedule 95 percent transactions day-ahead markets reduce chronic underscheduling load generation over-reliance ISO's real-time imbalance market meet supply. FERC also proposed penalty charge scheduling deviations excess 5 percent hourly load requirements. * Temporary modification auction bids $150 MWh cannot set market clearing paid bidders. * Establish independent, non-stakeholder governing boards California Power Exchange (PX) Independent System Operator (ISO). * Create congestion management design proposal. * Establish generation inter-connection procedures. Explore alternatives single auction ISO Develop market rules ensure sufficient supply available meet load reserve FERC approved changes protect wholesale customers unreasonable rates time take adopt longer-term market remedies. price mitigation measures remain effect Dec. 31, 2002: * Single-price auctions sales ISO PX markets $150 MWh. single price would used load clears amount auction. * auction clear $150 MWh level, suppliers choose bid $150 would paid price bid. words, highest bid day, $150 MWh, would longer clearing price paid all. * Sellers receiving $150 per MWh would required report bids FERC weekly basis provide certain cost information agency. * PX would required report monthly information bids, allowing FERC monitor competitive conditions assure reasonable rates. Sellers would subject potential refund liability lower marginal opportunity cost FERC finds non-competitive conditions. potential refund would extend full 24 months would take implement market reforms. NEW YORK -(Dow Jones)- California's wholesale electricity price cap far free-market prices Northwest large amounts state's electricity exported Wednesday Northwest, raising risk blackouts California. Printer-friendly version LOS ANGELES (Dow Jones)--The California Independent System Operator filed motion federal energy regulators asking four major power suppliers California stripped ability charge market rates allegedly gamed wholesale electricity market. Duke Energy (DUK, news, msgs), Dynegy Inc. (DYN, news, msgs), Mirant Corp. (MIR, news, msgs) Reliant Energy Inc. (REI, news, msgs) identified ISO exercising market power - ability influence electricity prices - California's wholesale power market. ISO, manages state's high-voltage transmission system, recently made similar filing AES Corp. (AES, news, msgs) Williams Cos. (WMB, news, msgs), claiming companies profited excessively California exercising market power. ISO wants Federal Energy Regulatory Commission revoke generators' authority charge market-based rates power supply. Tom Williams, spokesman Duke Energy, said company received FERC filing reviewing allegations. "We've obviously got filing we're reviewing going respond FERC filing. we're also gratified market forces work California prices come down," said. Richard Wheatley, spokesman Reliant, said ISO's allegations "nothing new." "It's similar nature issues allegations raised generators," Wheatley said. "The ISO incorrect asking emergency relief. situation California remains imbalance supply demand. blame game prohibits lasting solutions reached business climate California affected finger pointing." Steve Maviglio, press secretary Gov. Gray Davis, said governor "strongly supports attempt bring prices Californians break grip handful generators electricity market." ISO asked FERC terminate June 28 Dynegy's ability charge market prices power Southern California power plants schedule hearing determine rates based energy company's production costs. grid operator also wants Dynegy refund billions dollars, retroactive May 1, "of difference cost-based rates...and market revenues actually received." Similar requests made Duke, Reliant Mirant. "The ISO submitted compelling evidence exercise market power pervasive commission acknowledged...," according filing. filing, generators also accused "megawatt-laundering," suppliers sell power out-of-state California higher price. spent billion wholesale electricity 1999, $27 billion 2000 could pay much billion year. Charles Robinson, ISO's chief counsel, said "optimistic" state prevail "in one forum another able get relief we're seeking." said FERC implement "effective" market mitigation plan put brakes skyrocketing wholesale power prices. FERC set market mitigation plan, went effect 1, stabilize wholesale power prices operating reserves dip 7%. Robinson said plan good enough. Wholesale power prices seven-month low Thursday, due part new FERC plan, cooler temperatures, low natural-gas prices, conservation measures, energy officials said. Every three years, FERC reviews generators' ability charge market rates electricity. Generators first allowed charge market rates three years ago, unclear whether FERC ever stripped suppliers right charge market prices. *********** Market Participants: Please assure Notification forwarded respective Operating Departments Review --- Notification Operating Procedure Update * following new revised ISO Operating Procedures implemented posted reference ISO Website. * Please find http://www1.caiso.com/thegrid/operations/opsdoc/index.html appropriate Operating Procedure section heading.
